column4: I have seen quite a few posts in the forum on the FATAL shpchp and pciehp boot messages but no real solutions. Anyone here know how to get rid of them?
and it's in the FAQ, add the modules to /etc/hotplug/blacklists
that basically was the answer I got from the web search
since 2.6.11 is known broken and not in the supported section of ubuntu
one of the many unpleasant things about 2.6.11 is that it has no binary drivers built for it
if you don't know what you're doing, just leave it
you can make an apache-admin group own the apache config files
if you want a group of people to be able to edit the config files, make a new group, add people to it, then give that group permission to touch the files
change the docroot in apache2.conf to that dir then
